definition[0]: if information is out-of-date, it is not recent and may no longer be correct
example[0]: The information in the tourist guide is already out-of-date.
definition[1]: if something is out-of-date, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists
example[1]: Their manufacturing methods are hopelessly out-of-date.
definition[2]: an official document that is out-of-date cannot be used because the period of time for which it was effective has finished
definition[3]: things that are out-of-date are old, and therefore cannot be used or are not correct, fashionable etc
example[3]: complaints about out-of-date information used by credit bureaus
example[4]: These regulations are totally out-of-date in todayâ€™s worldwide marketplace.
